official-title.#text: To preserve religious freedom and a woman’s access to contraception.

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

should preserve a woman’s ability to

text.#text: Instead of restricting Americans’ religious freedoms,

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
has a strong interest in protecting the
			 free

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
has found a number of contraceptives to be proven safe and

that provide

text.#text: There are 5 programs, including the  Medicaid program, carried out by  the

Federal and State government spending for contraceptive services totaled $2,370,000,000 in fiscal
			 year 2010
			 and
			 the Medicaid program financed 75 percent of government spending for family
			 planning.

More than 19,000,000 women were eligible for government-supported contraceptive services in
			 2010.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
-approved
			 contraception and such contraception was covered by insurance at  over 85
			 percent of large businesses.

text.#text:
Even before Obamacare mandated that employers fully subsidize employees' contraception, women had
			 wide access to

Now, Obamacare’s various requirements cause an unprecedented intrusion of government mandates into
			 Americans’ personal health care decisions, including unprecedented Federal
			 mandates that employers become involved in those decisions, and the
			 individual mandate, which requires individuals to purchase health
			 insurance
			 or pay a penalty.

Obamacare has created an enormous disruption in the personal health insurance options of millions
			 of Americans whose health insurance plans were cancelled or whose
			 preferred doctors were not included  in their new health insurance plan
			 networks.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
estimates that Obamacare could reduce employment by the equivalent
			 of 2,000,000 jobs over the next 10 years.

text.#text: The

One of Obamacare’s mandates places 2,600,000 Americans, nearly two-thirds of them women, at risk of
			 having their hours and wages reduced, according to the Hoover Institution.

Obamacare’s cuts to the  Medicare Advantage program  and other regulatory actions could reduce the
			 average
			 benefit for women who rely on the program by $1,538 per year, or 13
			 percent.
Obamacare’s payroll tax increase creates an inequitable tax penalty for married working women.

Obamacare places limitations on health savings accounts, flexible spending accounts, and other
			 consumer-directed health savings vehicles, which help approximately
			 17,400,000 Americans to save for their own health expenses, including
			 contraceptives.

The current Administration has granted discretionary compliance waivers from Obamacare to a variety
			 of for-profit businesses, unions, and other organizations.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
has granted more than 1,000 individual waiver
			 requests for employers and insurers,
			 excusing the employers and insurers  from compliance with various aspects
			 of the law.
